questions.question: Everything ..................... she said is true.
questions.description: That is common after expressions like all, everything, anything, nothing, few etc.

questions.question: Everybody was there ............................ James.
questions.description: Except and except for are possible after words like all, every, no, anybody etc.

questions.question: ............................... your help, I would have failed.
questions.description: Without and but for are possible here.

questions.question: She has been like that ...................... her childhood.
questions.description: We prefer since here however, from is also possible.

questions.question: ............................... what you think.
questions.description: No matter is a conjunction. It doesn't matter is an expression used to introduce a sentence.

questions.question: This is fourth cake you ................................ this morning.
questions.description: We use a present perfect tense with 'this is the first / second / third / last etc.'

questions.question: Don’t come today. I would rather you .............................. tomorrow.
questions.description: After would rather, we use a past tense to refer to present or future,

questions.question: If I had gone to university, I .............................. business administration.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Nine o’clock. It is time you ....................... home.
questions.description: After it's time, we use a past tense with present meaning.

questions.question: They ........................... the man from head to foot.
questions.description: To search for is to look for something.

questions.question: I wasn’t pleased ................................ my exam results.
